title: Thesis award : Paul Caseau 2024
text:
It’s a great honour for me to have received the 2024 “Paul Caseau” thesis prize from EDF and Académie des Technologies for my PhD work on topology optimization of electrical machines! Congratulation also to Thomas Bellotti, with whom I share the prize, and also to the other laureates Rémi Dorget and Candelaria Utrilla Bustamante.
Link to my PhD thesis (in French), and soon to the pictures of the ceremony.

title: Fête de la Science 2025
text: Today, I gave a mini-conference at the “Fête de la Science 2025” at ENS Paris-Saclay on the topological optimization of electric motors, a popularization event. It’s always a pleasure to present my research to the general public! Thanks to Noemi Lanciotti for the photo.

title: RICAM Special Semester - workshop 2
text:
Together with Peter Gangl, I am organizing a workshop entitled “Advanced Techniques for Design Optimization in Engineering Applications”“. Many experts have confirmed their venues!
Registration is free but mandatory; check out the program!
This workshop is part of the RICAM 2025 Special Semester “Computational Methods for Electrical Machines.”

title: Keynote talk at CISTEM 2024
text:
I am honoured to give a keynote talk at IEEE CISTEM 2024 conference, entitled “Topology optimization of rotating electrical machines: state of the art and applications”.



Main amphitheater of ENSAM engineering school in Rabat, Morocco

title: Study of a new flux-switching machine
text:
Together with Pr. Sami Hlioui (CY Cergy Paris University), we are looking for master students to study a new flux-switching machine found by topology optimization, potentially with a reduced quantity of rare earth permanent magnets. The detailed internship description can be found here (in French).
Update : the position has been filled.

title: Implementation of FEM on interpetable neural networks
text:
Together with Dr. Alexandre Daby-Seesaram (École Polytechnique), we are looking for master students to implement the finite element method on interpretable neural network architectures. The internship description can be found here (in French).
Update : the position has been filled.

title: Théodore Cherrière
text:
Picture credit : Claudia Boerner

Welcome to my website,
I am Assistant Professor at CentraleSupélec (Université Paris-Saclay). I do my research in the GeePs laboratory. I teach electrical engineering, and my main research focuses on the topology optimization of electrical machines.
I hold a Ph.D. in electrical engineering from the Université Paris-Saclay (ENS Paris-Saclay), where I worked at the SATIE. My PhD thesis can be found here (in French). Then, I did a postdoctoral stay at RICAM, where I was associated member of the CREATOR research consortium.



CSMA 2024, Giens





PhD Thesis, p. 227

title: IEEE Magnetic Society webinar
text: I gave a IEEE Magnetic Society webinar entitled “Pushing creativity further in electrical machine design using topology optimization”.

title: Thesis award : SEE Ampère 2024
text: It’s a great honour for me to have received the 2024 “Ampère” thesis prize from SEE for my work on topology optimization of electrical machines! I gave a talk at the award ceremony, the slides are available here. Congratulation also to Icaro Veloso Soraes Link to my PhD thesis (in French), and soon to the pictures of the ceremony.

title: New position : Ass. Prof at CentraleSupélec
text: I’m pleased to announce that as of December 1, I’ll be taking up the position of Assistant Professor at CentraleSupélec. My research will be carried out in the GeePs laboratory.

title: Compumag 2025
text:
This week, I took part in the Compumag conference in Naples. I had three contributions with colleagues from RICAM (Nepomuk Krenn and Peter Gangl), G2ELab (Stéphane Gaydier) and ENS Paris-Saclay (Itaï Zehavi).
Congratulations to Stéphane, who received an honorable mention for his work and presentation on optimizing the air gap profile of an inductor to minimize AC losses! The code is available here.

title: Seminar LMS (X)
text: It was a pleasure and a honor to give a talk at Laboratory of Solid Mechanics (LMS); I presented the adjoint method together with some applications on topology optimization and magnetic forces computations, and had a lot of very interesting discussions!

title: Visit to GRUCAD - UFSC
text: Last week I had the chance to visit the GRUCAD institute, part of the Universidade Federal de Santa Catarina located on the beautiful island of Florianópolis, Brazil, as part of the OPTIMAT3D project supported by CAPES-COFECUB (grant number Ph1079/25). Together with Pr. Laurent Bernard, we worked on the topology optimization of a nonlinear inductor.

title: Research
text:
Work in progress

Hiped package for hierarchical interpolations, useful in multi-material density-based topology optimization.
Many other related things…
